CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new series of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) conjugated random terpolymers ( PBDTT-DPP-TPD ) were synthesized from electron - rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene ( BDTT ) , in conjugation with two electron - deficient units , pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DPP ) and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione ( TPD ) , of different electron - withdrawing strengths.

Let's think step by step.

1. Electron-rich thienyl-substituted benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT)
2. Pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP)
3. Thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)

These are the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph. They are the names of the different chemical compounds that were used in the synthesis of the new polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (BDTT)
2. Pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DPP)
3. Thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)

These are the relevant "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph. They are the names of the chemical compounds that were used in the synthesis of the new polymers. The other entities, such as "donor-acceptor," "conjugated random terpolymers," "electron-rich," and "electron-deficient," are not material names but rather describe the properties or structure of the resulting polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

3. Thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione (TPD)
